English: Hey Patrick, you're early here today. Ready to see if they still bite?
Man, they better do. Yesterday was pretty weak. I'm not supposed to show my face at home until I bring something worthwhile.
Your wife's making your life difficult as always, eh? Are you up for tonight then?
Sure I am, Jacques. I may be late but I'll definitely come.
But now, let us see if you are still the best angler on the island.
Ha ha, then let me show you how it's done.
Hey, what does a man have to do to get fuel around here?
After the broadcast, fella. I wouldn't want to miss this for the world.
Now keep quiet, it's starting!
You are listening to Le Marquis radio station. This morning is one of the most important dates of the old and noble republic of Everon.
We experienced a major outrage during the last presidential elections\nwhich were won by a populist right-wing candidate Edouard Daladier
who defeated the old time favourite Philippe Petain with the difference of one vote.
It was very heated in the parliament during the inauguration ceremony\nand it was boiling after Edouard Daladier presented his new government policies
which would transfer most if not all responsibilities from parliament to the office of the president.
Most senior politicians called him a fascist dictator and had to be escorted from the building.
His reforms unpopular, he faced three no-confidence votes which he survived with the support of his party and a few liberal turncoats.
Tensions grew as his bill finally passed the lower house and was close to being ratified.
The liberal party disputed the validity of the process and declared they would no longer take part in the parliament\nand walked out the same day.
Supporters of both sides clashed in the streets and even the militia couldn't keep the peace.\nAfter the latest riots in Lamentin the president declared a national emergency.
He asked the militia for support which he requires if he wishes to push his bill through the upper house during an emergency.
Gaston Astier, the general of the militia, refused to do so and was labelled as a traitor by Daladier.
With the political instability, unrest in the streets, opposition of the army and the inability of the government to function, \nwe are standing on the verge of a civil war.
Yesterday, Daladier agreed to meet with Astier in an effort to de-escalate the conflict.
At the moment these two men hold the most power on the island and their meeting could shape the future of the republic of Everon.
Our correspondent is present at this meeting taking place in Montignac, the capital city, and will be giving us the latest information.
Stay tuned to Le Marquis radio, the only news radio outlet in the archipelago.\nAnd may God be with us.
There he is, Gaston. Are you ready?
Let's get this over with. You got my back?
Always.
Good morning, Mr Daladier.
Greetings, Gaston Astier. It is good to see you.
Can't say I feel the same.
Why the hostility?
I am this close to commanding my militia to arrest you.
That would be unfortunate as my men would resist you. You would plunge our island into a civil strife.
Better a civil war than a dictatorship.
You are willing to go far, I can see that. What do you propose then?
Give up power. Confess you manipulated the elections. Walk away and let us return to peace again.
You do not seem to understand, I was elected by a democratic process. There was no falsifying, fraud or disinformation.\nI convinced people that we needed change.

The armies of both superpowers are on our borders\nand only a strong leader can deter them from turning our island into a battleground again.\nAnd a strong leader can't be held back by old men in parliament and naysayers.
If this is truly your vision for our republic then we have nothing more to discuss.\nReady your men because I will come for you tomorrow.
I expected you would see things this way. Luckily I made arrangements. I will not let you destroy everything we built here!
Do you hear that?
Yeah. Did we miss the announcement about a plane day again?
Look! Over the sea!
You sold us out?! To the Americans?!
It's either that or the Soviets. You must see it too!
Coward. We are free people and not slaves to some grand masters beyond the sea!
You and your backwards thinking are done, Astier. Soldiers, arrest that man!
He's getting away!
There he is!
Stay where you are or we will shoot!
Gaston, quickly get in!
Thank you, Jean. You just saved my life.
Hold on, friend. Our battle is just beginning.
